meta_description: Wilton House holds over 250 years of history, passing through six families and surviving two wars. It saw the rise and fall of landed gentry in the colonies, the birth of a new country, and the realities of generational slavery. Visit today to discover a unique Virginian story and experience 18th-century colonial life.

### Guided Tours Availability

Wednesday – Saturday

10:00 AM – 4:00 PM

Tours begin on the hour and are 45 minutes in length. The last tour of the day begins at 3:00 PM. Please note that availability is subject to change. For the most up-to-date information, please visit our Wilton House Museum [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/wiltonhousemuseum) or [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/wiltonhousemuseum/) channels.  
‍  

#### Adult & School Group Tours

We are proud to offer both adult (10+ people) and school group private tours of Wilton House Museum! Rates start at **$10.00** per adult and **$5.00** per child.   
  
Group tours must be scheduled in advance of your visit using the **Request a Group Tour** form on the right or by contacting us at (804) 282-5936 ext. 4 or [info@wiltonhm.org](mailto:info@wiltonhm.org?subject=Wilton%20Tour%20Request). Lunch or meeting facilities are also available with at least two weeks advance notice. 

#### Museum pet Policy

Wilton House Museum welcomes leashed animals on our grounds during our open hours. Animals must be kept under continuous control by their owners at all times and owners are responsible for cleaning up after their animal.  
  
Only registered service animals are allowed inside the historic home.

Wednesday-Saturday, 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM

# Accessibility Statement

Updated August 2023

## General

Wilton House Museum strives to ensure that its services are accessible to people with disabilities. Wilton House Museum has invested a significant amount of resources to help ensure that its website is made easier to use and more accessible for people with disabilities, with the strong belief that [website accessibility](https://userway.org/) efforts assist all users and that every person has the right to live with dignity, equality, comfort and independence.

## Accessibility on Wilton House Museum

Wilton House Museum makes UserWay's [Web Accessibility](https://userway.org/) Widget available which is powered by a dedicated accessibility server. The software allows Wilton House Museum to improve its compliance with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.1).

## Enabling the Accessibility Menu

The Wilton House Museum accessibility menu can be enabled by clicking the accessibility menu icon that appears on the corner of the page. After triggering the accessibility menu, please wait a moment for the accessibility menu to load in its entirety.

## Disclaimer

Wilton House Museum continues its efforts to constantly improve the accessibility of its site and services in the belief that it is our collective moral obligation to allow seamless, accessible and unhindered use also for those of us with disabilities.
